title: Sabrina Carpenter and Hailey Bieber Wore No Pants to the Met Gala - Shop the Look Here
description: Long gone are the days of fashion having strict rules. Many trends have come and gone and resurfaced again, from outlandish styles like the skirts-over-pants look of the 2000s to more practical aesthetics like the Sofia Richie-inspired quiet luxury. Of all the popular styles of the moment, we can't seem to escape the no-pants trend. While in the past, it was rare to step out without pants, celebrities have shamelessly and successfully produced several style moments that exclude the wardrobe essential. The 2025 Met Gala proved it's okay not to wear pants (once again), from Sabrina Carpenter's tuxedo bodysuit to Helen Lasichanh and Lisa's sheer monogrammed tights - all Louis Vuitton ensembles.Image Source: Getty While this trend is currently enjoying a moment in the spotlight, going pantless got popular as early as 2012. Miley Cyrus was among the first to try the bold styling method at the Billboard Music Awards that year, wearing a white Jean Paul Gaultier blazer with black-and-white striped heels. More stars eventually caught on, wearing oversize tops and jackets to give off the no-pants illusion throughout the years, from street style to Met Galas past - including Rihanna, Hailey Bieber, and Lizzo, just to name a few. Whether you're feeling a bit risqué or are inspired by this year's Met Gala red carpet, we've rounded up some of the best pieces to shop for your no-pants era, from sheer tights to bodysuits. And while you're at it, scroll through some of our favorite celebrity takes on the trend throughout the years.
author: Naomi Parris
excerpt: The 2025 Met Gala Was a No-Pants Parade, Shop the Risqué Trend Here
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. The outfit featured a white tank top and black high-rise shorts worn under a mesh dress with beaded embellishments.Getty | Robert KamauRihanna's No-Pants Martine Rose and Balenciaga OutfitIn true Rihanna fashion, she rocked an oversize Martine Rose jersey, a red Balenciaga puffer, Amina Muaddi crystal heels, an R13 baseball hat, Saint Laurent crystal earrings, and blue-and-red Miu Miu gloves.Getty | Theo WargoCandice Swanepoel's No-Pants OutfitWhile attending the Venice Film Festival, the South African model rocked an unassuming look — a blue-and-white striped oversize button-down with a black belt and heels to match.Getty | BG002/Bauer-GriffinHailey Bieber's No-Pants Margiela OutfitBieber wore a simple white Margiela shirt and boots to match, with a black leather blazer and sunglasses while out and about in LA.Getty | Gilbert CarrasquilloKim Kardashian's Pants-Less OutfitWhile leaving the Plaza Hotel, Kardashian wore a black ensemble, featuring sheer tights over a pair of black silky string panties, a leather bandeau top and blazer, and clear plastic shoes.Getty | GothamJennifer Lopez's No-Pants Versace and Hermès OutfitFor a casual day out in NYC, Lopez wore an oversize white T-shirt and Versace denim boots, along with an Hermès bag, her nameplate necklace, Le Vian jewels, and a pair of oversize sunglasses. Dressed in a short belted jacket teamed with black tights and platform heels, Beckham looked as chic and sultry as ever. Naomi Parris is the assistant shopping editor at PS, based in New York. With over eight years of experience and previous roles held on the brand's Beauty and Operations teams, she enjoys telling stories that merge fashion, beauty, and Black culture. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Long gone are the days of fashion having strict rules. Many trends have come and gone and resurfaced again, from outlandish styles like the skirts-over-pants look of the 2000s to more practical aesthetics like the Sofia Richie-inspired quiet luxury. Of all the popular styles of the moment, we can't seem to escape the no-pants trend. While in the past, it was rare to step out without pants, celebrities have shamelessly and successfully produced several style moments that exclude the wardrobe essential. The 2025 Met Gala proved it's okay not to wear pants (once again), from Sabrina Carpenter's tuxedo bodysuit to Helen Lasichanh and Lisa's sheer monogrammed tights — all Louis Vuitton ensembles.

While this trend is currently enjoying a moment in the spotlight, going pantless got popular as early as 2012. Miley Cyrus was among the first to try the bold styling method at the Billboard Music Awards that year, wearing a white Jean Paul Gaultier blazer with black-and-white striped heels. More stars eventually caught on, wearing oversize tops and jackets to give off the no-pants illusion throughout the years, from street style to Met Galas past — including Rihanna, Hailey Bieber, and Lizzo, just to name a few.

Whether you're feeling a bit risqué or are inspired by this year's Met Gala red carpet, we've rounded up some of the best pieces to shop for your no-pants era, from sheer tights to bodysuits. And while you're at it, scroll through some of our favorite celebrity takes on the trend throughout the years.

Pantyhose

Hue French Lace Control Top Pantyhose ($12)

A staple brand in the hosiery department, Hue is the perfect place to get sheer tights that will nail this Met Gala trend. We love the lace panty illusion on this style that flatters the hips and legs seamlessly.

Affordable Sheer Tights

Swiiduu High Waist Fishnet Stockings ($13)

One thing we love about the sheer tights trend? You can get it at any price point. These under-$20 fishnet stockings are super stretchy and can be worn for any occasion from date nights to weddings.

Boy Shorts

Calvin Klein Modern Boyshort ($15-$22)

Kylie Jenner showed us underwear is the new pants, and this boy short is the perfect way to nail her vibe. We love this pick from Calvin Klein for its figure-flattering fit and plush 100 percent cotton.

Opaque Sheer Tights

Caldezonia Totally Invisible 30 Denier Tights ($25)

Beloved by customers for comfort and quality, these semi-opaque tights are a more unconventional, yet classic take on the no-pants trend. The minimal design can add a timeless look to any outfit, and there's even an invisible effect seamless waistband that ensures maximum comfort.

Cutout Sheer Tights

Natori Lace Cutout Tights ($32)

The no-pants trend is all about sexiness, and these cutout lace tights from Natori exude just that. Whether you're wearing them with an oversize white button-down or a black blazer, you're sure to turn heads all night.

A White Button-Down

Gap Poplin Big Shirt ($36, originally $60)

One of the most classic ways to nail the no-pants trend is by styling your sheer tights with a white button-down. This big shirt from Gap has the perfect loose fit that extends below the hip, allowing your legs to be the focal point of your look.

A Black Blazer

Zara Oversized Double Breasted Blazer ($70)

A black blazer is already a wardrobe must have, but it's also a more tasteful way to pull off wearing no pants. We love this oversize number from Zara that features a classic lapel collar and shoulder pads for that nostalgic flair.

A Black Bodysuit

Norma Kamali Tara Shirred Front Mio Bodysuit ($150)

Bodysuits are another great way to nail the no-pants trend, which is why we're obsessed with this one from Norma Kamali. Its smocked shoulder straps and slightly shirred waist make it the perfect layering or standalone piece. Feel free to layer it over tights and heels or go full Sabrina Carpenter and wear it alone.

Taylor Swift's No-Pants Outfit

Spotted on the streets of New York City, Taylor Swift delivered a preppy take on the no-pants trend wearing a Stella McCartney oversize polo shirt with nothing but Prada knee-high boots.

Sofia Vergara's No-Pants Bodysuit

Sofia Vergara tried on black, brown, and beige bodysuits from her Walmart fall 2023 collection, forgoing pants altogether. She finished the look with straight strands and a matte brown lip — what else do you need?

Jenna Dewan's Pants-Less Mugler Bodysuit

In an Instagram post, the dancer wore her new Mugler bodysuit with lilac pants.

Dove Cameron's No-Pants Coach Look

Cameron wore a floor-length trench coat and a pair of six-inch heels by Coach, sheer black tights, and a midriff-baring bralette with spaghetti straps. She finished the powerful look with a set of jade cat-eye sunglasses.

Megan Fox's No-Pants Look

The star delivered yet another daring style moment with a plunging bodysuit and tights at Machine Gun Kelly's Berlin performance on June 7, 2023.

Lizzo's No-Pants Yitty Outfit

For the 2023 Met Gala, Lizzo performed in a silver, sparkly Yitty one-shoulder bodysuit with metallic over-the-knee boots.

Ciara's No-Pants Celine Look

The risk-taking singer wore an all-black outfit that consisted of a cutout Celine sweater and knee-high lugged sole boots while attending Paris Fashion Week.

Bella Hadid's No-Pants Look

While grabbing pizza with then-boyfriend Marc Kalman in September 2022, the supermodel wore a vintage LEGO t-shirt, white boy-briefs, a black-and-blue Opening Ceremony leather jacket, and brown UGG boots. She completed the look with black sunglasses from Choppers and a white tote bag.

Kylie Jenner's No-Pants Loewe Outfit

During Paris Fashion Week in 2022, Jenner wore Loewe's infamous white cropped tank, underwear over sheer black tights, and a gray wool coat. She accessorized with black mask sunglasses from the same brand.

Sydney Sweeney's Pants-Less Miu Miu Outfit

During a work trip in Berlin, the actress wore a tan Miu Miu trench coat with white crew socks, black heeled combat boots, a leather bag to match, and tinted sunglasses.

Maya Hawke's Pants-Less Look

While attending Milan Fashion Week, the "Stranger Things" actress wore a blue-and-white gingham shirt styled as a dress with sheer black tights and block heels. She topped the ensemble with a black Prada handbag.

Keke Palmer's No-Pants Prada Look

During an appearance on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon," Palmer gave off the no-pants illusion wearing all-Prada. The outfit featured a white tank top and black high-rise shorts worn under a mesh dress with beaded embellishments.

Rihanna's No-Pants Martine Rose and Balenciaga Outfit

In true Rihanna fashion, she rocked an oversize Martine Rose jersey, a red Balenciaga puffer, Amina Muaddi crystal heels, an R13 baseball hat, Saint Laurent crystal earrings, and blue-and-red Miu Miu gloves.

Candice Swanepoel's No-Pants Outfit

While attending the Venice Film Festival, the South African model rocked an unassuming look — a blue-and-white striped oversize button-down with a black belt and heels to match.

Hailey Bieber's No-Pants Margiela Outfit

Bieber wore a simple white Margiela shirt and boots to match, with a black leather blazer and sunglasses while out and about in LA.

Kim Kardashian's Pants-Less Outfit

While leaving the Plaza Hotel, Kardashian wore a black ensemble, featuring sheer tights over a pair of black silky string panties, a leather bandeau top and blazer, and clear plastic shoes.

Jennifer Lopez's No-Pants Versace and Hermès Outfit

For a casual day out in NYC, Lopez wore an oversize white T-shirt and Versace denim boots, along with an Hermès bag, her nameplate necklace, Le Vian jewels, and a pair of oversize sunglasses.

Nicki Minaj's No-Pants Off-White Look

While attending a New York Fashion Week kickoff party, Minaj stepped out in black high-waisted panties and a matching bra, along with a yellow blazer from Off-White. She also wore black over-the-knee boots from the same brand.

Miley Cyrus's Pants-Less Jean Paul Gaultier Look

Cyrus wore a white Jean Paul-Gaultier blazer with black-and-white striped heels from Christian Louboutin for the 2012 Billboard Music Awards.

Hailey Bieber's No-Pants Saint Laurent Look

Hailey Bieber stepped out for dinner at Hôtel Costes in Paris during Fashion Week sporting Petar Petrov hot pants with a Saint Laurent belt over sheer Calzedonia tights. The Rhode founder teamed her underwear with a fitted nude bodysuit from Alaïa and layered a floor-sweeping Balenciaga leather coat on top, finishing with a Jil Sander purse, Jimmy Choo pumps, black sunglasses, and chunky metal earrings.

Ellie Goulding's Black Briefs and Fishnet Tights

Ellie Goulding took the stage at The Roundhouse wearing a bold take on the no-pants trend. She teamed black briefs with fishnet tights and boots for an outfit that proves the look is here to stay.

Nicola Peltz Beckham's Pants-Less Belted Jacket

Nicola Peltz Beckham was on hand to support her family at the "Beckham" UK premiere, delivering a unique take on the no-pants trend. Dressed in a short belted jacket teamed with black tights and platform heels, Beckham looked as chic and sultry as ever.

Naomi Parris is the assistant shopping editor at PS, based in New York. With over eight years of experience and previous roles held on the brand's Beauty and Operations teams, she enjoys telling stories that merge fashion, beauty, and Black culture. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.
